message:
TiP BoF is BYOB. Please be discreet when bringing it into the hotel.
Stores nearby http://bit.ly/dF39Ee http://bit.ly/ftryHt. #pycon
because apparently georgia laws prohibit drinking alcohol in public places (e.g. conference rooms)
but it can be liek distributed testing bof

@mishok13 very true. my general concern is that they'll be on the lookout for more "offenders." the discreet part is critical and my thinking is that nothing should be unveiled until after the BoF gets started.
we're good if that's so
Worst case, just take over another hotel room. The Scotch BoF ended up being a lot of fun even though we got shutdown by Teh Law
For what I know, yesterday's Scotch BoF had to move from hannover e to one of the hotel rooms
Under the table. ;)
well, yeah, but i think tip bof will attract more people than scotch one did
i'm not up for drinking much today, so i guess bringing 3 bottles of beer discreetly is not an issue
but what if they do check the room after the session starts?
under the table is not considered a public place in GA, is it?
it was something around 15 to 20 people at 1431 room yesterday
several rooms at once, with messages (booze) being passed between nodes (rooms)
@gthank multiboozing or from twisted.internet.protocols import BoozeProtocol, BoozeFactory
@wolever l'm easily enough of a realist to know that those two statements are not contradictory. In fact I'd argue that they're mutually-reinforcing.
map reduce is more understandable, if you can keep the drinks localized per processor
@Paul_Collins patches are welcome
They allow booze bought in the hotel, just not stuff brought in from outside.
@palendae that's not what we heard from the guy from hyatt management team. it was more along the lines -- you can only drink in bars and rooms
@offby1 mmm true. Shows what I know about liqueur laws :) cc:@bitprophet
it might be possible that some people have rooms right next to each other. Maybe they could open the doors between the rooms?
@wolever The Django BOF had an official open bar/bartender and there were no problems; the Chef BOF next door was kicked out for bringing in outside booze and had to relocate to a room.
@mishok13 Are you suggesting a mpi4booze.py ?
oooh, ok
@offby1 actually, I suspect it really is the liqueur laws. I don't think the bar would (knowingly) let you walk out with a beer.
@mishok13 Someone there had beer from the bar; they let her keep it.

Thinking maybe that we make it booze free. I'd rather have a great open space than have it fractured into a bunch fo different rooms. Anyone have thoughts on this? TiP might be less epic, but it can still be fun and informative.
@gthank Will it be NUMA enabled?
but if youhave to start sharing drinks, there can be bandwidth errors
Yeah, I'm pretty sure it's outside booze (ie: that doesn't line the hotel's pockets) that's forbidden.
@bitprophet I would like to point out that having it in a suite was way cooler IMO.
@benjaminws the number of empty bottle left over was impressive. I'm hoping the cleaning staff doesn't think poorly of me ^^;;;
@benjaminws for sure, the suite was pretty rad...and yea, TiP BOF would require an entire floor of suites really.
@Paul_Collins  I should have stayed :(
Had a pretty good time at another party though.
i'm ok with tip bof being sober
Too bad one suite wouldn't fit all of the tip bof :(
that's where mpi4booze.py comes in!
It would probably make it less of a hassle to go booze free.
Maybe I'll just go get me a flask :P
@terryp I'll be avoiding booze tonight anyway, but that's just me. I'd say only about <=50% of the Good Times Feeling last year was booze fueled anyways :)
Yes, I'm thinking booze free is the best idea.
Yeah, booze free saves the hassle or trying to relocate tons of people.
